p: The DPPH values for the water extracts of P. ostreatus and A. bisporus before irradiation were 56 and 48 Âµmol TE/g fraction. As observed for the FC-reducing compounds, the specific DPPH values for the ethanol-insoluble fractions of both mushrooms were higher than those of the corresponding water-soluble fractions. The genus Agaricus has been previously found to have the highest DPPH radical scavenging properties among the most widely appreciated cultivated mushrooms [ 36]. UV irradiation decreased the DPPH values of all fractions, except for the ethanol-insoluble fraction of A. bisporus.
